citation.article-title: Diaphorobacter oryzae sp. nov., isolated from a thiosulfate-oxidizing enrichment culture
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Diaphorobacter oryzae sp. nov.
Diaphorobacter oryzae (o.ry′zae. L. gen. n. oryzae of rice, referring to the rice-paddy fields from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, oxidase-positive, catalase-positive, aerobic, denitrifying and rod-shaped (0.5–0.8×1.3–1.8 μm) and possess a single polar flagellum.
Forms circular colonies with regular edges within 2 days, with diameters of approximately 1.3–2.0 mm.
Reduces nitrate but does not oxidize thiosulfate.

Positive for arginine dihydrolase, protease, β-glucosidase and urease, and utilization of acetate, propionate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, potassium gluconate, l-alanine, dl-lactate, valerate, l-proline, d-glucose, l-serine, l-histidine, 2-ketogluconate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, caprate and malate.
No acid is produced from glucose.

Negative in tests for β-galactosidase, for hydrolysis of starch, casein and DNA, and for utilization of mannitol, salicin, melibiose, l-fucose, d-sorbitol, l-arabinose, rhamnose, N-acetylglucosamine, d-ribose, inositol, sucrose, maltose, malonate, 5-ketogluconate, glycogen, 3-hydroxybenzoate, citrate, d-mannose, adipate, itaconate, suberate and phenylacetate.
Carbon and nitrogen source utilization and enzymic activities are detailed in Table 2.
Ubiquinone-8 is the major respiratory quinone.
The major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, C17 : 0 cyclo, and C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH.
The type strain, RF3T (=KCTC 22225T=LMG 24467T), was isolated from a thiosulfate-oxidizing enrichment culture from paddy soils in Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 62.9 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
Strain RF21 is a second strain of the species.
